plot_guapo: Highly stylized data visualization function

plot_guapo.Rd

Generates ggplot2 graphics with high visual impact, utilizing modern color palettes, distinctive fonts, and advanced visual effects from `ggfx`.

Usage

plot_guapo(
  data,
  x = NULL,
  y = NULL,
  color_var = NULL,
  fill_var = NULL,
  label_var = NULL,
  title = "Visualización de Datos Impactante",
  subtitle = "Con Estilo y Diseño Avanzado",
  caption = "Generado con plot_guapo",
  plot_type = c("scatter", "line", "column", "area", "map"),
  palette_name = c("guapo", "guapero", "guapon", "guapisimo"),
  font_title_name = "Orbitron",
  font_body_name = "Poppins",
  show_labels = FALSE,
  add_trend_line = FALSE,
  highlight_values = NULL,
  highlight_color = "#FFD700",
  facet_var = NULL,
  dark_mode = FALSE,
  apply_shadow = FALSE,
  apply_glow = FALSE,
  apply_blur_background = FALSE,
  gradient_fill = FALSE,
  base_alpha = 0.8,
  geom_size = 3,
  geom_stroke = 0.5,
  text_size = 20
)

Arguments

data

A data frame (or an `sf` object for `plot_type = "map"`).

x

(Optional) Name of the column for the x-axis (can be unquoted for tidy evaluation). Defaults to NULL.

y

(Optional) Name of the column for the y-axis (can be unquoted for tidy evaluation). Defaults to NULL.

color_var

(Optional) Name of the column to map to color (can be unquoted). Defaults to NULL.

fill_var

(Optional) Name of the column to map to fill (can be unquoted). Defaults to NULL.

label_var

(Optional) Name of the column for data labels (can be unquoted). Defaults to NULL.

title

The main title of the plot.

subtitle

The subtitle of the plot.

caption

The caption or source of the plot.

plot_type

The type of plot: "scatter", "line", "column", "area", "map".

palette_name

The name of the color palette to use: "guapo", "guapero", "guapon", "guapisimo".

font_title_name

The Google Font for the plot title.

font_body_name

The Google Font for the body text and axes.

show_labels

Logical, whether to display data labels. Defaults to FALSE.

add_trend_line

Logical, whether to add a trend line (only for scatter/line plots). Defaults to FALSE.

highlight_values

A vector of values in `x`, `color_var`, or `label_var` to highlight. Defaults to NULL.

highlight_color

The color for highlighted values. Defaults to "#FFD700" (Gold).

facet_var

(Optional) Name of the column to facet the plot by (can be unquoted). Defaults to NULL.

dark_mode

Logical, whether to use a dark color scheme. Defaults to FALSE.

apply_shadow

Logical, whether to apply a shadow effect to geometric elements. Requires `ggfx`. Defaults to FALSE.

apply_glow

Logical, whether to apply a glow effect to geometric elements. Requires `ggfx`. Defaults to FALSE.

apply_blur_background

Logical, whether to apply a blur effect to the panel background. Requires `ggfx`. Defaults to FALSE.

gradient_fill

Logical, whether to use a gradient fill for continuous variables (note: this parameter isn't directly used in the provided code for scale generation; scales are determined automatically based on variable type). Defaults to FALSE.

base_alpha

The base transparency of the geometric elements. Defaults to 0.8.

geom_size

The base size of points or thickness of lines. Defaults to 3.

geom_stroke

The border thickness of points. Defaults to 0.5.

text_size

The base text size for the plot. Defaults to 20.

Value

A ggplot2 object.
